files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,7 @@
+Thu Aug 12 15:30:29 1999  Jesse Perry  (jap@unx.dec.com)
+
+	* configure.in (alpha*-dec-osf*): Add osf5.
+
 Sun Aug  1 22:24:03 1999  Philip Blundell  <philb@gnu.org>
 
 	* configure.in: Rework handling of ARM GNU/Linux slightly.

@@ -84,6 +84,7 @@ program_suffix=NONE
 program_transform_name=s,x,x,
 silent=
 site=
+sitefile=
 srcdir=
 target=NONE
 verbose=
@@ -198,6 +199,7 @@ Configuration:
   --help                  print this message
   --no-create             do not create output files
   --quiet, --silent       do not print \`checking...' messages
+  --site-file=FILE        use FILE as the site file
   --version               print the version of autoconf that created configure
 Directory and file names:
   --prefix=PREFIX         install architecture-independent files in PREFIX
@@ -368,6 +370,11 @@ EOF
   -site=* | --site=* | --sit=*)
     site="$ac_optarg" ;;
 
+  -site-file | --site-file | --site-fil | --site-fi | --site-f)
+    ac_prev=sitefile ;;
+  -site-file=* | --site-file=* | --site-fil=* | --site-fi=* | --site-f=*)
+    sitefile="$ac_optarg" ;;
+
   -srcdir | --srcdir | --srcdi | --srcd | --src | --sr)
     ac_prev=srcdir ;;
   -srcdir=* | --srcdir=* | --srcdi=* | --srcd=* | --src=* | --sr=*)
@@ -533,12 +540,16 @@ fi
 srcdir=`echo "${srcdir}" | sed 's%\([^/]\)/*$%\1%'`
 
 # Prefer explicitly selected file to automatically selected ones.
-if test -z "$CONFIG_SITE"; then
-  if test "x$prefix" != xNONE; then
-    CONFIG_SITE="$prefix/share/config.site $prefix/etc/config.site"
-  else
-    CONFIG_SITE="$ac_default_prefix/share/config.site $ac_default_prefix/etc/config.site"
+if test -z "$sitefile"; then
+  if test -z "$CONFIG_SITE"; then
+    if test "x$prefix" != xNONE; then
+      CONFIG_SITE="$prefix/share/config.site $prefix/etc/config.site"
+    else
+      CONFIG_SITE="$ac_default_prefix/share/config.site $ac_default_prefix/etc/config.site"
+    fi
   fi
+else
+  CONFIG_SITE="$sitefile"
 fi
 for ac_site_file in $CONFIG_SITE; do
   if test -r "$ac_site_file"; then
@@ -593,7 +604,7 @@ copy=cp
 # - two terminals occur directly after each other
 # - the path contains an element with a dot in it
 echo $ac_n "checking LIBRARY_PATH variable""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:597: checking LIBRARY_PATH variable" >&5
+echo "configure:608: checking LIBRARY_PATH variable" >&5
 case ${LIBRARY_PATH} in
   [:\;]* | *[:\;] | *[:\;][:\;]* |  *[:\;]. | .[:\;]*| . | *[:\;].[:\;]* )
     library_path_setting="contains current directory"
@@ -618,7 +629,7 @@ fi
 # - two terminals occur directly after each other
 # - the path contains an element with a dot in it
 echo $ac_n "checking GCC_EXEC_PREFIX variable""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:622: checking GCC_EXEC_PREFIX variable" >&5
+echo "configure:633: checking GCC_EXEC_PREFIX variable" >&5
 case ${GCC_EXEC_PREFIX} in
   [:\;]* | *[:\;] | *[:\;][:\;]* |  *[:\;]. | .[:\;]*| . | *[:\;].[:\;]* )
     gcc_exec_prefix_setting="contains current directory"
@@ -949,7 +960,7 @@ else { echo "configure: error: can not run $ac_config_sub" 1>&2; exit 1; }
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking host system type""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:953: checking host system type" >&5
+echo "configure:964: checking host system type" >&5
 
 host_alias=$host
 case "$host_alias" in
@@ -970,7 +981,7 @@ host_os=`echo $host | sed 's/^\([^-]*\)-\([^-]*\)-\(.*\)$/\3/'`
 echo "$ac_t""$host" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking target system type""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:974: checking target system type" >&5
+echo "configure:985: checking target system type" >&5
 
 target_alias=$target
 case "$target_alias" in
@@ -988,7 +999,7 @@ target_os=`echo $target | sed 's/^\([^-]*\)-\([^-]*\)-\(.*\)$/\3/'`
 echo "$ac_t""$target" 1>&6
 
 echo $ac_n "checking build system type""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:992: checking build system type" >&5
+echo "configure:1003: checking build system type" >&5
 
 build_alias=$build
 case "$build_alias" in
@@ -1015,7 +1026,7 @@ test "$host_alias" != "$target_alias" &&
 # Extract the first word of "gcc", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy gcc; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1019: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1030: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_CC'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1045,7 +1056,7 @@ if test -z "$CC"; then
   # Extract the first word of "cc", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy cc; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1049: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1060: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_CC'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1096,7 +1107,7 @@ fi
       # Extract the first word of "cl", so it can be a program name with args.
 set dummy cl; ac_word=$2
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_word""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1100: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1111: checking for $ac_word" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_CC'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1128,7 +1139,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1132: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5
+echo "configure:1143: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5
 
 ac_ext=c
 # CFLAGS is not in ac_cpp because -g, -O, etc. are not valid cpp options.
@@ -1139,12 +1150,12 @@ cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross
 
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext << EOF
 
-#line 1143 "configure"
+#line 1154 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 main(){return(0);}
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1148: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1159: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   ac_cv_prog_cc_works=yes
   # If we can't run a trivial program, we are probably using a cross compiler.
   if (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null; then
@@ -1170,12 +1181,12 @@ if test $ac_cv_prog_cc_works = no; then
   { echo "configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables." 1>&2; exit 1; }
 fi
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) is a cross-compiler""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1174: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) is a cross-compiler" >&5
+echo "configure:1185: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) is a cross-compiler" >&5
 echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross" 1>&6
 cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether we are using GNU C""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1179: checking whether we are using GNU C" >&5
+echo "configure:1190: checking whether we are using GNU C" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_gcc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1184,7 +1195,7 @@ else
   yes;
 #endif
 EOF
-if { ac_try='${CC-cc} -E conftest.c'; { (eval echo configure:1188: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; } | egrep yes >/dev/null 2>&1; then
+if { ac_try='${CC-cc} -E conftest.c'; { (eval echo configure:1199: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; } | egrep yes >/dev/null 2>&1; then
   ac_cv_prog_gcc=yes
 else
   ac_cv_prog_gcc=no
@@ -1203,7 +1214,7 @@ ac_test_CFLAGS="${CFLAGS+set}"
 ac_save_CFLAGS="$CFLAGS"
 CFLAGS=
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1207: checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g" >&5
+echo "configure:1218: checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1246,7 +1257,7 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1250: checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}" >&5
+echo "configure:1261: checking whether ${MAKE-make} sets \${MAKE}" >&5
 set dummy ${MAKE-make}; ac_make=`echo "$2" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_prog_make_${ac_make}_set'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
@@ -1274,7 +1285,7 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether a default assembler was specified""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1278: checking whether a default assembler was specified" >&5
+echo "configure:1289: checking whether a default assembler was specified" >&5

@@ -1286,7 +1297,7 @@ else
 fi

-echo "configure:1290: checking whether a default linker was specified" >&5
+echo "configure:1301: checking whether a default linker was specified" >&5

 	echo "$ac_t""yes ($DEFAULT_LINKER)" 1>&6
@@ -1303,7 +1314,7 @@ do
 # Extract the first word of "$ac_prog", so it can be a program name with args.

-echo "configure:1307: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1318: checking for $ac_word" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1335,7 +1346,7 @@ done

-echo "configure:1339: checking for $ac_word" >&5
+echo "configure:1350: checking for $ac_word" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

@@ -1369,15 +1380,15 @@ then

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"

-#line 1381 "configure"
+#line 1392 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -1388,7 +1399,7 @@ int main() {
 yywrap()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:1392: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:1403: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -1411,7 +1422,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether ln works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1415: checking whether ln works" >&5
+echo "configure:1426: checking whether ln works" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

@@ -1443,7 +1454,7 @@ else

@@ -1475,19 +1486,19 @@ else

@@ -1510,7 +1521,7 @@ fi
